required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Anlotinib Hydrochloride Combined With EGFR-Tyrosine Kinase Inhibitor (TKI) in Treating Advanced NSCLC Patients With Acquired Resistance to EGFR-TKI
clinical_study.official_title: Safety and Efficacy of Anlotinib Hydrochloride Combined With Epidermal Growth Factor Receptor Tyrosine Kinase Inhibitors (EGFR TKIs) in Treating Advanced Non-small-cell Lung Cancer (NSCLC) Patients With Acquired Resistance to EGFR TKIs

collaborator.agency: Chia Tai Tianqing Pharmaceutical Group Co., Ltd.

brief_summary.textblock: The Single-arm, multicenter study evaluate the safety and efficacy of Anlotinib Hydrochloride combined with EGFR TKIs in treating Advanced NSCLC With acquired Resistance to EGFR TKIs

detailed_description.textblock: EGFR TKI have been approved as first-line treatment in NSCLC patients harboring EGFR mutation. However, the acquired resistance of EGFR-TKI occurs almost constantly. Anlotinib is a novel oral multitarget tyrosine kinase inhibitor and primary targeted to Vascular Endothelial Growth Factor Receptor (VEGFR), fibroblast growth factor receptor (FGFR) , platelet-derived growth factor receptor (PDGFR) and c-Kit. The ALTER-0303 trial showed that patients with advanced non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) who received anlotinib as third-line or further therapy had more survival benefit. The Single-arm, multicenter study evaluate the safety and efficacy of Anlotinib Hydrochloride combined with EGFR TKIs in treating Advanced NSCLC With acquired Resistance to EGFR TKIs

primary_outcome.time_frame: From randomization to the first occurrence of disease progression or death from any cause, whichever occurs earlier, assessed up to 1 year

secondary_outcome.measure: 6 months and 12 months progression-free survival (PFS) Rate

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the date of randomization to the date of death from any cause，assessed up to 2 year

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events [Safety and Tolerability]
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 21 days post-the last treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: progression-free survival (PFS) for different types of EGFR mutation
Overall survival (OS) for different types of EGFR mutation

arm_group.description: Patients receive anlotinib (12 mg orally daily for 14 days every 21 days cycle) combined with one of following EGFR-TKIs: Gefitinib is administered 250 mg once per day. Erlotinib is administered 150 mg once per day , or Icotinib is administered 125 mg three times per day, until disease progression or untolerated toxicity.

intervention.description: anlotinib (12 mg orally daily for 14 days every 21 days cycle) combined with one of EGFR-TKIs

overall_official.affiliation: Guangdong General Hospital (GGH)& Guangdong Academy of Medical Sciences
